text: hey everybody today I'm super excited to
share with you a DIY trick that will be
saving you money at the grocery store it
is making chicken cutlets at home so
don't go to the store and buy those
pricy chicken cutlets buy instead
boneless skinless chicken breasts and
today at the supermarket you can buy
these in family packs flip the chicken
breasts over and remove the tender the
tender is this long thin piece of
chicken and you can save this for
chicken fingers
so now method number one for making
chicken cutlets is to cut your chicken
breasts in half horizontally so I have a
very sharp boning knife here and halfway
through the breast I'm going to cut and
as I'm cutting pull back the top part of
the breast so that you can see what
you're doing and you want to stay as
close to the middle of the breast as
possible so that you get to even cutlets
this works best with larger chicken
breasts and there you go you have to
thin cutlets now if you really wanted
something super super thin you could
pound these out but I think these are
the perfect size for chicken parmesan if
you wanted a quick piccata that would be
great
now the second method in making chicken
cutlets at home I'm gonna take my second
breast here again remove the tender and
leaving the breast skin side down make a
vertical cut lengthwise down the chicken
breast you want to go about maybe a half
an inch in and now angle your knife and
make a horizontal cut opening up one
side of the chicken breast so you're
almost there opening it up like a book
and you're gonna repeat the process on
the other side now I'm gonna turn this
just because I am right-handed again
with your knife angling it slightly so
that you're creating a horizontal cut
you're opening up the chicken breast
into one flat even layer as you can see
there's slight unevenness in thickness
and I'm gonna show you an easy way to
achieve a nice thin even breast and
that's by pounding it plastic really
helps in the chicken not sticking to the
surface of your board and keeping
everything nice
clean I have another piece of plastic
wrap that you can place right over top
and so now to even out the cutlet a
little bit I'm using a meat mallet now
you want to make sure we use the smooth
side of the meat mallet do not use the
textured side the textured side will
break up the muscle fibers and that's
not what you're looking for you could
also use a rolling pin or a pot a small
pot and to pound out the chicken you're
going to pound and kind of move the
mallet away from you slightly so don't
go straight down like this as you go
down and hit the breasts move it out and
you're really only doing this slightly
to even out the meat and this process of
making the cutlet and even thickness
will help ensure even cooking and there
you go
two easy methods in making chicken
cutlets at home and the beauty here is
that there are endless possibilities you
can make piccata you could make parmesan
you could make grilled parts and you
guys you're saving a little bit of money
too so now you know the trick in making
cutlets at home enjoy
you
